citeinfo.origin: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), Office for Coastal Management (OCM)
citeinfo.title: Time-Series Data on the Ocean and Great Lakes Economy for Counties, States, and the Nation between 2005 and 2020 (Sector Level)

pubinfo.publish: NOAA's Ocean Service, Office for Coastal Management (OCM)

descript.abstract: Economics: National Ocean Watch (ENOW) contains annual time-series data for over 400 coastal counties, 30 coastal states, 8 regions, and the nation, derived from the Bureau of Labor Statistics and the Bureau of Economic Analysis. It describes six economic sectors that depend on the oceans and Great Lakes and measures four economic indicators: Establishments, Employment, Wages, and Gross Domestic Product (GDP).
descript.purpose: ENOW organizes economic data in ways that focus directly on economic activity dependent on the oceans and Great Lakes.
descript.supplinf: This data complies with the Information Quality Act directive from the Office of Management and Budget. The Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) revise their GDP estimates for all years of data on an annual basis. With the annual release of new ENOW data, gross domestic product (GDP) for the ocean economy are updated for the entire time series to reflect the revision of GDP. In addition, BEA rebenchmark the entire GDP account every five years to better reflect the evolving nature of the U.S. economy. The rebenchmarking involves making changes to what is included in different industries, as well as classifying new and emerging industries. The current benchmark for the GDP industries is 2012. An additional industry, Fish and Seafood Merchant Wholesalers (NAICS 424460) was added to the Living Resources sector's Seafood Market industry for data years 2016 and beyond. The industry was not applied to earlier years.

dataqual.logic: To ensure the quality of the data, we checked that all data was present for the ENOW defined geography, verified and formatted data types, ensured that suppressed data were flagged as -9999, and normalized dollar figures into real numbers.
dataqual.complete: To ensure the completeness of the data set, zeros were added to counties with no data for any or all sectors. This does not change the integrity of the data but allows for easier visualization. Zeros in the data indicate that there is no employment, establishment, wage, or GDP data based on the ENOW definitions of ocean related economic activity. -9999 indicates that data have been suppressed to avoid disclosing data confidentiality of information provided by employers to the Bureau of Labor Statistics. According to the U.S. Census Bureau, three coastal counties in Alaska (02201, 02232, 02280) were deleted during the time series of the dataset and were replaced by four newly formed counties (02105, 02195, 02198, 02275). All of these counties are provided in the dataset for historical context, and have data for all sectors reported as 0 for years where the county does not exist.

citeinfo.title: Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages (QCEW)
citeinfo.othercit: NOAA OCM received this data from another federal agency (Bureau of Labor Statistics). Questions regarding the original data collection and /or processing should be directed to that agency.

srcinfo.srccontr: Industry level data on establishment, employment, and wages for 5 non-Tourism and Recreation sectors

citeinfo.title: Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages (QCEW)
citeinfo.othercit: NOAA OCM received this data from another federal agency (Bureau of Labor Statistics). Questions regarding the original data collection and /or processing should be directed to that agency.

srcinfo.srccontr: Establishment level data on establishments, employment, and wages for Tourism and Recreation and Ocean Economy sectors for Shore-Adjacent ENOW Counties

citeinfo.title: Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages (QCEW)

srcinfo.srccontr: Establishment level data on employment and wages for 26 Participating ENOW States

citeinfo.title: ZIP Code Business Patterns
citeinfo.othercit: NOAA OCM received this data from another federal agency (US Census Bureau). Questions regarding the original data collection and /or processing should be directed to that agency.

srcinfo.srccontr: Zip code level data on establishments, employment, and wages for 4 non-participating states (Michigan, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, and New York).

citeinfo.title: Gross Domestic Product (GDP) by State
citeinfo.othercit: NOAA OCM received this data from another federal agency (Bureau of Economic Analysis). Questions regarding the original data collection and /or processing should be directed to that agency.

srcinfo.srccontr: State level totals of gross domestic product (GDP) at the industry levels

procstep.procdesc: Developed totals of establishments, employment, and wages using definitions of ocean related economic activity developed by the National Ocean Economics Program.
Developed GDP using definitions of ocean related economic activity developed by the National Ocean Economics Program.
